results.title: Circulating levels of MOTS-c in patients with breast cancer treated with metformin
results.text_hl: Although @<m>DISEASE_Cytochrome_c_Oxidase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030401 @@@MOTS-c@@@ MoA largely overlap those of the anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @CHEMICAL_Biguanides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001645 @@@biguanide@@@ @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, the putative regulatory actions of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Cytochrome_c_Oxidase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030401 @@@MOTS-c@@@ have not yet been evaluated in detail.

citations.NLM: Cuyàs E, Verdura S, Martin-Castillo B, Menendez JA, METTEN study group. Circulating levels of MOTS-c in patients with breast cancer treated with metformin Aging (Albany NY). 2022 Dec 9;14():. PMID: 36490309
